<<<<<<< HEAD
Batt upon Batt A poem upon the parts, patience, and pains, of Barth. Kempster, clerk, poet, cutler, of Holy-Rood-Parish in Southampton. By a person of quality. To which is annexed the vision, wherein is described Batt's person and ingenuity; with an account of the antient and present state and glory of Southampton. By the same author. Dedicated to the gentry of Hampshire, for their diversion: but more especially to the inhabitants of Southampton. Speed, John, 1628-1711. Speed, John, 1628-1711. Vision.
12 p.
printed for Samuel Crouch, London : 1690.
"The vision": p. 7-12. In verse. A person of quality = John Speed. Imperfect; title page has print show-through affecting legibility. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Dedicated to the gentry of Hampshire, for their diversion: but more especially to the inhabitants of Southampton. Speed, John, 1628-1711. Speed, John, 1628-1711. Vision.
12 p.
printed for Samuel Crouch, London : 1690.
"The vision": p. 7-12. In verse. A person of quality = John Speed. Imperfect; title page has print show-through affecting legibility. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
